intro: Siphocampylus divaricatus, commonly known as the zigzag lily, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, zigzagging stems. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, and its leaves are typically pinnately divided. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
